About me

Hello! I'm Sanskar. I am currently a Grad Student at SUNY Stony Brook majoring in Computer Science . When I'm not writing elegant lines of code, you can find me strategizing epic chess moves, swinging cricket bats, or travelling solo across the world. I believe in embracing diverse passions to fuel creativity. From designing time-saving APIs to imporving GPS security, I've tackled a wide-range of tech challenges. So, if you're looking for a software developer who can solve problems and have fun along the way, I'm your guy. Let's create something extraordinary together and share a laugh or two!

View Resume

Projects

Covid Substance Abuse and Resource Prediction

In the exciting project "Covid Substance Abuse and Resource Prediction," I delved into the depths of data to uncover insights during the challenging times of the pandemic. By mining Reddit data, I explored the alarming rise in substance abuse risk during Covid-19. Leveraging techniques such as time series analysis, I also developed a forecasting model to predict hospital bed and staffing deficits with a one-week lead time, empowering healthcare preparedness in the face of the pandemic. With Python, PySpark, PyTorch, and Git as my trusty tools, I embarked on this data-driven journey to make a positive impact on public health.

See Live Source Code

Detection of Location Spoofing in Vehicles

Embarking on a mission to fortify GPS security, I took on the exhilarating challenge of detecting vehicles attempting to spoof their location. Armed with Python, PyTorch, and Git, I developed a solution to prevent unauthorized manipulation of GPS signals by vehicles equipped with Software Defined Radios. Leveraging sensor data and employing the prowess of a multiclass classifier, I achieved an impressive 90% accuracy in predicting the lane and speed of the spoofing vehicle. This project was a thrilling dive into the world of networking, where I combined my passion for innovation with my expertise in machine learning to safeguard the integrity of location-based systems.

PySanitize: Secure Pickle Serialization

In my pursuit of creating secure and reliable pickle files, I developed a library called Py Sanitize. This library makes the process of Pickle serialization secure by implementing an allowlist-based sanitizer. By meticulously filtering and validating inputs, Py Sanitize effectively thwarts potential code injection attacks, ensuring the integrity and safety of pickle files.

See Live Source Code
